message: my question is, should I ignore this behaviour or can I rely on it and exploit it as some sort of renewable lease where I only have to periodically renew the non-joined group (say every 60 seconds, while the UI is presented to the user)

so I've notice that, when letting a user interact with a group that they don't belong to, if I make a single authenticated request to live with the group_id specified, my 'regular' live poller starts to get events for the group I specified in the *other* live request
I'd say you can rely on it
the point being to avoid running two (or more) persistent and concurrent pollers
this will continue for about 90 seconds so I assume something is timing out
We have no intention of changing that behavior
